BP_Bug_BeetleC_C.name: Cimice maculata
BP_Bug_BeetleC_C.description:
A bug known more for his strong musk than its striking colors.
Found all around Kilima and Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_ButterflyC_C.name: Farfalla azzurra
BP_Bug_ButterflyC_C.description:
Ever resilient. Butterflies of this type can be found in almost every climate in Palia.
Found all around Kilima and Bahari Bay during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_ButterflyR_C.name: Farfalla occhidisole
BP_Bug_ButterflyR_C.description:
Whenever you see the sun out, you can see the eyes of this intricately patterned butterfly looking around Bahari Bay.
Found in the Forests of Bahari Bay during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_ButterflyU_C.name: Farfalla crepuscolare
BP_Bug_ButterflyU_C.description:
A beautiful butterfly with wings the color of dusk. Unique to the Kilima Valley.
Found around the Dragon Shrine in Kilima during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_CicadaC_C.name: Cicala di corteccia
BP_Bug_CicadaC_C.description:
A common cicada.
Found attached to trees in Bahari Bay during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_CicadaR_C.name: Cicala infuocata
BP_Bug_CicadaR_C.description:
A spirited cicada, whose bark is worse than its bite.
Found attached to trees in Bahari Bay during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_CicadaU_C.name: Cicala cerulea
BP_Bug_CicadaU_C.description:
The call of this cicada is so soothing, it was said to be the inspiration for Ayana's fourth symphony.
Found attached to trees in Bahari Bay during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_CrabC_C.name: Granchio bahariano
BP_Bug_CrabC_C.description:
A local crab, known to taste good with drawn butter.
Found along the coast of Bahari Bay. Also has a chance to be found when foraging shells in Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_CrabU_C.name: Granchio spinoso
BP_Bug_CrabU_C.description:
A crab with a very spiny shell.
Found along the coast of Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_CricketC_C.name: Grillo campestre
BP_Bug_CricketC_C.description:
Field crickets can be found anywhere you can find a field.
Found all around Kilima and Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_CricketR_C.name: Locusta pietrazzurra
BP_Bug_CricketR_C.description:
This little blue beauty has been known to camouflage itself as a shiny blue pebble.
Found in the fields of Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_CricketU_C.name: Cicalina
BP_Bug_CricketU_C.description:
The Garden Leafhopper is such a delight in Palia that many children keep them as pets. They are said to bring good luck.
Found in the fields and Badruu's Farm in Kilima. Also has a chance to be found when foraging in Kilima.

BP_Bug_DragonflyC_C.name: Libellula coda a pennello
BP_Bug_DragonflyC_C.description:
The tail of this Dragonfly is so bright and vibrant, some early Majiri were said to have used it as a paintbrush.
Found around the lake in Kilima, as well as rivers and ponds in Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_DragonflyE_C.name: Libellula alagemma
BP_Bug_DragonflyE_C.description:
A Dragonfly with wings as bright and colorful as any precious stone.
Found near a cave entrance on a cliff in Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_DragonflyR_C.name: Libellula spirafuoco
BP_Bug_DragonflyR_C.description:
This Dragonfly is notoriously difficult to catch, in part due to its fiery breath.
Found in the fields of Kilima.

BP_Bug_DragonflyU_C.name: Libellula inchiostro
BP_Bug_DragonflyU_C.description:
This stealthy Dragonfly is used as a component in various black dyes and inks.
Found around rivers and ponds in Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_GlowbugC_C.name: Insetto lanterna
BP_Bug_GlowbugC_C.description:
This bug glows as brightly as a colorful feast day lantern taking flight into the Palian night sky.
Found along the coast and in forests of Bahari Bay during the evening and night.

BP_Bug_LadybugR_C.name: Coccinella principessa
BP_Bug_LadybugR_C.description:
A very regal looking lady bug, made popular by the children's fairytale, The Princess Who Turned Into A Ladybug.
Found around the lake in Kilima.

BP_Bug_LadybugU_C.name: Coccinella
BP_Bug_LadybugU_C.description:
A black and red ladybug, popular for controlling garden pests.
Has a chance to be found when foraging in the fields of Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_MantisE_C.name: Mantide fatata
BP_Bug_MantisE_C.description:
A mantis from early Majiri legend only recently confirmed to exist by modern entomologists. Said to have magical properties.
Found in the fields of Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_MantisR1_C.name: Mantide maculata
BP_Bug_MantisR1_C.description:
A rare mantis with a beautiful set of spots.
Found around the Dragon Shrine in Kilima.

BP_Bug_MantisU_C.name: Mantide da giardino
BP_Bug_MantisU_C.description:
Nothing to see here. Just your garden variety mantis.
Found around the lake in Kilima. Also has a chance to be found when foraging around the lake in Kilima.

BP_Bug_MothC_C.name: Falena notturna di Kilima
BP_Bug_MothC_C.description:
While beautiful, the Kilima night moth is so prevalent on hot summer nights that some consider it to be a pest. Keep away from stored cloth.
Found all around Kilima and Bahari Bay during the evening and night.

BP_Bug_MothR_C.name: Falena velata
BP_Bug_MothR_C.description:
The wings of this moth are so thin that some say you can see a peek of the Dragon Realm by looking through them.
Found in the fields of Kilima during the evening and night.

BP_Bug_MothU_C.name: Falena lunare
BP_Bug_MothU_C.description:
The Lunar Fairy Moth is said to have a very special connection to the Dragon Moon, and is said to only appear at special times during its cycle.
Found in the fields and forests of Bahari Bay during the evening and night.

BP_Bug_PedeR1_C.name: Millepiedi peloso
BP_Bug_PedeR1_C.description:
A millipede with a hair growth problem.
Found in the forests of Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_PedeR2_C.name: Centopiedi scintillino
BP_Bug_PedeR2_C.description:
A rare centipede with a shiny hard shell.
Has a chance to be found when mining in Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_PedeU_C.name: Millepiedi delle serre
BP_Bug_PedeU_C.description:
A brown and green millipede that loves feasting on garden crops.
Found in the fields of Kilima. Also has a chance to be found when foraging in the fields of Kilima.

BP_Bug_SnailU_C.name: Chiocciola da giardino
BP_Bug_SnailU_C.description:
A snail that has evolved over time to look like a leaf. Good for hiding from predators, bad for hiding from the Leafstalker Mantis.
Found along the coast and in forests of Bahari Bay.

BP_Coral_C.name: Corallo
BP_Coral_C.description: Portate la spiaggia a casa vostra con questo pezzo di corallo. Si sente quasi il profumo della barriera corallina!

BP_Gatherable_Elouisa_Dropoff_C.name: Trappola per flatuline
BP_Gatherable_Elouisa_Dropoff_C.description: Un normalissimo posto adatto ad attirare e catturare flatuline.

BP_Gatherable_MushroomBlue_C.name: Fungo luminoso
BP_Gatherable_MushroomBlue_C.description: I funghi luminosi si illuminano assorbendo il flusso e hanno quindi molti usi alchemici.

BP_Gatherable_MushroomR_C.name: Spugnola di montagna
BP_Gatherable_MushroomR_C.description: Fungo comune, le spugnole di montagna possono essere trovate nella propria casa! Molto apprezzate, sia crude che cotte.

BP_Gatherable_Ruins_C.name: Antico cimitero
BP_Gatherable_Ruins_C.description: Il posto ideale a cui restituire una statua.

BP_HeartdropLilly_C.name: Giglio cuore
BP_HeartdropLilly_C.description: Il giglio del cuore è un fiore raro che ha un significato speciale per i paliani: lo sbocciare dell'amore romantico.

BP_Moss_DragonsBeard_C.name: Torba barbadrago
BP_Moss_DragonsBeard_C.description: La torba Dragon's Beard è un raro muschio alchemico che prende il nome dal suo colore, che ricorda quello del Maji.

BP_Moss_EmeraldCarpet_C.name: Muschio smeraldino
BP_Moss_EmeraldCarpet_C.description: Si dice che riempire la casa con il colore brillante dell'Emerald Carpet Moss porti fortuna.

BP_Oyster_C.name: Ostrica chiusa
BP_Oyster_C.description: Aprite quest'ostrica! Anche se non trovate una perla, potete almeno mangiarla.

BP_PoisonFlower_C.name: Margherita di rovo
BP_PoisonFlower_C.description: La Briar Daisy di montagna può sopravvivere anche alle condizioni più difficili.

BP_Seashell_C.name: Conchiglia
BP_Seashell_C.description: Chi vende conchiglie in riva al mare? Nessuno. Dovevate trovarle da soli.

BP_Spice_DariCloves_C.name: Chiodi di garofano Dari
BP_Spice_DariCloves_C.description: Il raro chiodo di garofano di Dari è una spezia amata da chef e alchimisti. Si dice che abbia proprietà magiche.

BP_Spice_HeatRoot_C.name: Radice del calore
BP_Spice_HeatRoot_C.description: Non sudare! Che si tratti di cucinare o di curare, la radice piccante Heat Root vi riscalderà dall'interno.

BP_Spiced_Sprouts_C.name: Germogli di spezie
BP_Spiced_Sprouts_C.description: I germogli di spezie conferiscono un colore ricco e un sapore terroso a qualsiasi piatto. E sono anche piuttosto facili da trovare....

BP_SundropLillies_C.name: Giglio gocciadisole
BP_SundropLillies_C.description: Il giglio smeraldino cresce in campi aperti dove può rivolgere i suoi petali alla luce del sole.

BP_SweetLeaves_C.name: Katuk
BP_SweetLeaves_C.description: I più golosi apprezzeranno questa foglia dolce, uno degli ingredienti preferiti di Palia per i suoi dessert.

BP_WaterFlower_C.name: Loto di lago
BP_WaterFlower_C.description: Il Crystal Lake Lotus prende il nome dal luogo in cui è stato scoperto ed è oggi utilizzato per la produzione di tinture.

BP_WildGarlic_C.name: Aglio selvatico
BP_WildGarlic_C.description: L'aglio è un'aggiunta deliziosa a qualsiasi piatto cucinato! Oppure può essere mangiato crudo per profumare l'alito.
